thread.title: HGTV's Fixer Upper stars Chip and Joanna Gaines toy with a move out of Waco to create more family time
thread.title_full: HGTV's Fixer Upper stars Chip and Joanna Gaines toy with a move out of Waco to create more family time

author: Maria Halkias
title: HGTV's Fixer Upper stars Chip and Joanna Gaines toy with a move out of Waco to create more family time
text:
Close Staff Photographer HGTV's Fixer Upper stars Chip and Joanna Gaines toy with a move out of Waco to create more family time Filed under Retail at Get Daily Dallas News Headlines Sign Up   
WACO -- As business demands cause them to travel more, taking them away from their four young children, the stars of HGTV's Fixer Upper Chip and Joanna Gaines said Tuesday that they've considered leaving Waco temporarily. 
The idea of a move came up Tuesday in small-group interviews with reporters and bloggers that was part of a KILZ Master Class and media tour of the Magnolia Market at the Silos in Waco. Joanna Gaines applies her new KILZ chalk paint to a small box Tuesday, Feb. 21, 2017 at a KILZ paint Master Class in Waco. KILZ makes Magnolia paint. DMN staff photo 
They don't sound too serious. But they said they talk about how to improve work life balance as they've been required to travel more since they became Fixer Upper stars and expanded into furniture, rugs, pillows, throws, paint and publishing. 
Joanna spoke of her love of New York in a session with The Dallas Morning News. 
People magazine reported late Tuesday that the Gaineses said in another interview session that they have considered moving from Waco for a time. 
"We talk about it. We've been to Kansas City a lot recently and have just fallen in love with that community," Chip told People . "Salt Lake, every time we go there it just kind of really inspires us, obviously New York City for Jo. There are a few cities across the country that we would possibly consider if Waco did not work out." 
Chip said to People , "Las Vegas would be fun." 
Joanna said, "New York City, I think would be fun." 
Joanna said to The Dallas Morning News that she has always loved New York City and says she finds inspiration from the small boutiques and large stores such as ABC Carpet and Home. 
"Anytime I have a chance to go back...I love it. I draw inspiration from it," Joanna said. "We even went there for our honeymoon." 
Chip confirmed her feelings saying "we go floor by floor when we're in ABC Carpet and Home." 
"I'm opposite," Chip said. "For me it's about waking up in the morning and messing with the animals." The Gaineses live on a 40-acre farm with goats and chickens and lots of other animals. 'Fixer Upper' trickle-downers: Meet Dallas businesses seeing gains from Gaines family 
Joanna said she started framing her interest in home design while wandering into home boutiques on her off time as an intern in New York with CBS News and Dan Rather. She was a broadcast journalism major at Baylor University. 
"I was so homesick I would go to these small boutiques that felt like home," Joanna said. "When I came back this whole thing of design kind of developed in my heart as a dream." 
"I wanted to create that same experience for other people, to come into my store and stay and linger," she said. "I couldn't afford anything. I loved the candles, fresh flowers and the music."
